intro: Tupa besseriana, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to deep red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its leaves are heart-shaped and glossy, often with a slight hairy texture. Tupa besseriana thrives in tropical climates and is well adapted to the humid, warm conditions of Hawaii.
